description: This file defines the ZerodhaBroker class, a Python implementation of a brokerage interface for Zerodha, used within an autonomous trading bot. It provides methods for checking connection status, placing orders, getting positions, and retrieving profile info, serving as a stub for Zerodha integration.

classes.name: ZerodhaBroker
classes.description: A stub class that mimics Zerodha stock trading platform integration, implementing the BrokerInterface.

methods.name: __init__(self, api_key: Optional[str], api_secret: Optional[str], access_token: Optional[str])
methods.description: Initializes the ZerodhaBroker with API credentials and access token.

methods.name: bool _connected(self)
methods.description: Checks if the broker is authenticated by verifying presence of API credentials and access token.

methods.name: OrderResponse place_order(self, symbol: str, side: str, qty: int, price: float | None = None)
methods.description: Attempts to place a stock order; currently a stub that returns a dummy response.

methods.name: list[dict] get_positions(self)
methods.description: Retrieves current position data; currently returns an empty list.

methods.name: dict get_profile(self)
methods.description: Returns the profile details indicating the mode and connection status.

calls: OrderResponse(order_id="N/A", status="REJECTED", message="Not authenticated with Zerodha")

ctags.name: __init__
ctags.pattern: /^    def __init__(self, api_key: Optional[str], api_secret: Optional[str], access_token: Optional/
ctags.signature: (self, api_key: Optional[str], api_secret: Optional[str], access_token: Optional[str])

ctags.name: place_order
ctags.pattern: /^    def place_order(self, symbol: str, side: str, qty: int, price: float | None = None) -> Order/
ctags.signature: (self, symbol: str, side: str, qty: int, price: float | None = None)
